availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Beverly A. Seaver (Montgomery County, Kentucky, clerk, teacher, and lawyer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, teacher and attorney. New York native. Married to Luckett Anderson Seaver in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on April 26, 1864. Teacher in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1860. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 278.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 310A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 0002522359.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Montgomery County, KY, September 1863, p. 345.
“Deaths,” The Weekly Kansas Chief (Troy, KS), August 24, 1899, p. 8.
"Death of B.A. Seaver," The Highland Vidette (Highland, KS), January 28, 1904, p. 1
KYR-0001-004-1096
